titleStmt.title: The loving enemies a comedy : as it was acted at His Highness the Duke of York's Theatre / written by L. Maidwell.
titleStmt.author: Maidwell, Lewis, 1650-1715.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A51422 of text R10838 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing M284). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 175 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 41 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

Images scanned from microfilm: (Early English books, 1641-1700 ; 427:5)

titleStmt.title: The loving enemies a comedy : as it was acted at His Highness the Duke of York's Theatre / written by L. Maidwell.
titleStmt.author: Maidwell, Lewis, 1650-1715.
Shadwell, Thomas, 1642?-1692. Virtuoso.

notesStmt.note: Written by Lewis Maidwell, whose name has been given variously as Lawrence and John Maidwell. Cf. Venn, J. Alum. cant.; Summers, M. Playhouse of Pepys, 1935, p. 434-436; BM; Baker, D.E. Companion to the play-house, 1764, v. 1.
Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library.

ep:epHeader.ep:title: The Loving Enemies
ep:epHeader.ep:defectRangePerGrade: The rate of 35.62 defects per 10,000 words puts this text in the D category of texts with between 35 and 100 defects per 10,000 words.
